MetadataTemplate.description: A template for metadata that can be applied to files and folders.

id.description: The ID of the metadata template.

scope.description:
The scope of the metadata template can either be `global` or
`enterprise_*`. The `global` scope is used for templates that are
available to any Box enterprise. The `enterprise_*` scope represents
templates that have been created within a specific enterprise, where `*`
will be the ID of that enterprise.

templateKey.description:
A unique identifier for the template. This identifier is unique across
the `scope` of the enterprise to which the metadata template is being
applied, yet is not necessarily unique across different enterprises.

displayName.description:
The display name of the template. This can be seen in the Box web app
and mobile apps.

hidden.description:
Defines if this template is visible in the Box web app UI, or if
it is purely intended for usage through the API.

fields.description:
An ordered list of template fields which are part of the template. Each
field can be a regular text field, date field, number field, as well as a
single or multi-select list.

items.description:
A field within a metadata template. Fields can be a basic text, date, or
number field, or a list of options.

allOf.title: Metadata Field (Read)
allOf.description:
A field within a metadata template. Fields can be a basic text, date, or
number field, or a list of options.

type.description:
The type of field. The basic fields are a `string` field for text, a
`float` field for numbers, and a `date` fields to present the user with a
date-time picker.

Additionally, metadata templates support an `enum` field for a basic list
of items, and ` multiSelect` field for a similar list of items where the
user can select more than one value.

**Note**: The `integer` value is deprecated.
It is still present in the response,
but cannot be used in the POST request.

key.description:
A unique identifier for the field. The identifier must
be unique within the template to which it belongs.

displayName.description:
The display name of the field as it is shown to the user in the web and
mobile apps.

description.description: A description of the field. This is not shown to the user.

hidden.description:
Whether this field is hidden in the UI for the user and can only be set
through the API instead.

options.description:
A list of options for this field. This is used in combination with the
`enum` and `multiSelect` field types.

items.title: Metadata Option (Write)
items.description:
An option for a Metadata Template Field.

Options only need to be provided for fields of type `enum` and `multiSelect`.
Options represent the value(s) a user can select for the field either through
the UI or through the API.

key.description:
The text value of the option. This represents both the display name of the
option and the internal key used when updating templates.

id.description: The unique ID of the metadata template field.

options.description:
A list of options for this field. This is used in combination
with the `enum` and `multiSelect` field types.

items.description:
An option for a Metadata Template Field.

Options are only present for fields of type `enum` and
`multiSelect`. Options represent the value(s) a user can
select for the field either through the UI or through the API.

allOf.title: Metadata Option (Write)
allOf.description:
An option for a Metadata Template Field.

Options only need to be provided for fields of type `enum` and `multiSelect`.
Options represent the value(s) a user can select for the field either through
the UI or through the API.

key.description:
The text value of the option. This represents both the display name of the
option and the internal key used when updating templates.

id.description: The internal unique identifier of the option.

copyInstanceOnItemCopy.description: Whether or not to include the metadata when a file or folder is copied.

PostOAuth2Revoke.description: A request to revoke an OAuth 2.0 token.

client_id.description:
The Client ID of the application requesting to revoke the
access token.

client_secret.description:
The client secret of the application requesting to revoke
an access token.

PostOAuth2Revoke.title: Token revocation request

PostOAuth2Token.description: A request for a new OAuth 2.0 token.

grant_type.description:
The type of request being made, either using a client-side obtained
authorization code, a refresh token, a JWT assertion, client credentials
grant or another access token for the purpose of downscoping a token.

client_id.description:
The Client ID of the application requesting an access token.

Used in combination with `authorization_code`, `client_credentials`, or
`urn:ietf:params:oauth:grant-type:jwt-bearer` as the `grant_type`.

client_secret.description:
The client secret of the application requesting an access token.

Used in combination with `authorization_code`, `client_credentials`, or
`urn:ietf:params:oauth:grant-type:jwt-bearer` as the `grant_type`.

code.description:
The client-side authorization code passed to your application by
Box in the browser redirect after the user has successfully
granted your application permission to make API calls on their
behalf.

Used in combination with `authorization_code` as the `grant_type`.

refresh_token.description:
A refresh token used to get a new access token with.

Used in combination with `refresh_token` as the `grant_type`.

assertion.description:
A JWT assertion for which to request a new access token.

Used in combination with `urn:ietf:params:oauth:grant-type:jwt-bearer`
as the `grant_type`.

subject_token.description:
The token to exchange for a downscoped token. This can be a regular
access token, a JWT assertion, or an app token.

Used in combination with `urn:ietf:params:oauth:grant-type:token-exchange`
as the `grant_type`.

subject_token_type.description:
The type of `subject_token` passed in.

Used in combination with `urn:ietf:params:oauth:grant-type:token-exchange`
as the `grant_type`.

actor_token.description:
The token used to create an annotator token.
This is a JWT assertion.

Used in combination with `urn:ietf:params:oauth:grant-type:token-exchange`
as the `grant_type`.

actor_token_type.description:
The type of `actor_token` passed in.

Used in combination with `urn:ietf:params:oauth:grant-type:token-exchange`
as the `grant_type`.

scope.description:
The space-delimited list of scopes that you want apply to the
new access token.

The `subject_token` will need to have all of these scopes or
the call will error with **401 Unauthorized**..

resource.description: Full URL for the file that the token should be generated for.

box_subject_type.description: Used in combination with `client_credentials` as the `grant_type`.

box_subject_id.description:
Used in combination with `client_credentials` as the `grant_type`.
Value is determined by `box_subject_type`. If `user` use user ID and if
`enterprise` use enterprise ID.

box_shared_link.description:
Full URL of the shared link on the file or folder
that the token should be generated for.

PostOAuth2Token.title: Token request

PostOAuth2Token--RefreshAccessToken.description:
A request to refresh an Access Token. Use this API to refresh an expired
Access Token using a valid Refresh Token.

grant_type.description: The type of request being made, in this case a refresh request.

client_id.description: The client ID of the application requesting to refresh the token.

client_secret.description: The client secret of the application requesting to refresh the token.

PostOAuth2Token--RefreshAccessToken.title: Refresh access token

RealtimeServer.description:
A real-time server that can be used for
long polling user events.

ttl.description: The time in minutes for which this server is available.

max_retries.description:
The maximum number of retries this server will
allow before a new long poll should be started by
getting a [new list of server](#options-events).

retry_timeout.description:
The maximum number of seconds without a response
after which you should retry the long poll connection.

This helps to overcome network issues where the long
poll looks to be working but no packages are coming
through.

RealtimeServer.title: Real-time server

be used for long-polling.

RetentionPolicy.description:
A retention policy blocks permanent deletion of content
for a specified amount of time. Admins can create retention
policies and then later assign them to specific folders, metadata
templates, or their entire enterprise.  To use this feature, you must
have the manage retention policies scope enabled
for your API key via your application management console.

description.description: The additional text description of the retention policy.
description.example: Policy to retain all reports for at least one month

policy_type.description:
The type of the retention policy. A retention
policy type can either be `finite`, where a
specific amount of time to retain the content is known
upfront, or `indefinite`, where the amount of time
to retain the content is still unknown.

retention_type.description:
Specifies the retention type:

* `modifiable`: You can modify the retention policy. For example,
 you can add or remove folders, shorten or lengthen
 the policy duration, or delete the assignment.
 Use this type if your retention policy
 is not related to any regulatory purposes.

* `non-modifiable`: You can modify the retention policy
 only in a limited way: add a folder, lengthen the duration,
 retire the policy, change the disposition action
 or notification settings. You cannot perform other actions,
 such as deleting the assignment or shortening the
 policy duration. Use this type to ensure
 compliance with regulatory retention policies.

status.description:
The status of the retention policy. The status of
a policy will be `active`, unless explicitly retired by an
administrator, in which case the status will be `retired`.
Once a policy has been retired, it cannot become
active again.

allOf.description:
A mini user object representing the user that
created the retention policy.

created_at.description: When the retention policy object was created.

modified_at.description: When the retention policy object was last modified.

can_owner_extend_retention.description:
Determines if the owner of items under the policy
can extend the retention when the original
retention duration is about to end.

are_owners_notified.description:
Determines if owners and co-owners of items
under the policy are notified when
the retention duration is about to end.

custom_notification_recipients.description: A list of users notified when the retention policy duration is about to end.

assignment_counts.description: Counts the retention policy assignments for each item type.

enterprise.description: The number of enterprise assignments this policy has. The maximum value is 1.

folder.description: The number of folder assignments this policy has.

metadata_template.description: The number of metadata template assignments this policy has.

RetentionPolicy.title: Retention policy

RetentionPolicy--Base.description: A base representation of a retention policy.

id.description: The unique identifier that represents a retention policy.

RetentionPolicy--Base.title: Retention policy (Base)

RetentionPolicy--Mini.description:
A mini representation of a retention policy, used when
nested within another resource.

policy_name.description: The name given to the retention policy.

retention_length.description:
The length of the retention policy. This value
specifies the duration in days that the retention
policy will be active for after being assigned to
content.  If the policy has a `policy_type` of
`indefinite`, the `retention_length` will also be
`indefinite`.

disposition_action.description:
The disposition action of the retention policy.
This action can be `permanently_delete`, which
will cause the content retained by the policy
to be permanently deleted, or `remove_retention`,
which will lift the retention policy from the content,
allowing it to be deleted by users,
once the retention policy has expired.

RetentionPolicy--Mini.title: Retention policy (Mini)

RetentionPolicyAssignment.description:
A retention assignment represents a rule specifying
the files a retention policy retains.
Assignments can retain files based on their folder or metadata,
or hold all files in the enterprise.

id.description: The unique identifier for a retention policy assignment.

allOf.description:
A mini representation of a retention policy object
that has been assigned to the content.

assigned_to.description:
The `type` and `id` of the content that is under
retention. The `type` can either be `folder`
`enterprise`, or `metadata_template`.

id.description:
The ID of the folder, enterprise, or metadata template
the policy is assigned to.
Set to null or omit when type is set to enterprise.

type.description: The type of resource the policy is assigned to.

filter_fields.description:
An array of field objects. Values are only returned if the `assigned_to`
type is `metadata_template`. Otherwise, the array is blank.

value.description:
The metadata attribute field id. For value, only
enum and multiselect types are supported.

allOf.description:
A mini user object representing the user that
created the retention policy assignment.

assigned_at.description:
When the retention policy assignment object was
created.

start_date_field.description:
The date the retention policy assignment begins.
If the `assigned_to` type is `metadata_template`,
this field can be a date field's metadata attribute key id.

RetentionPolicyAssignment.title: Retention policy assignment

source_files.description: List of files to create a signing document from. This is currently limited to ten files. Only the ID and type fields are required for each file.

signers.description: Array of signers for the signature request.

signature_color.description: Force a specific color for the signature (blue, black, or red).

id.description: Box Sign request ID.

prepare_url.description:
This URL is returned if `is_document_preparation_needed` is
set to `true` in the request. The parameter is used to prepare
the signature request
using the UI. The signature request is not
sent until the preparation
phase is complete.

allOf.description:
Reference to a file that holds a log of all signer activity for
the request.

status.description: Describes the status of the signature request.

sign_files.description:
List of files that will be signed, which are copies of the original
source files. A new version of these files are created as signers sign
and can be downloaded at any point in the signing process.

is_ready_for_download.description:
Indicates whether the `sign_files` documents are processing
and the PDFs may be out of date. A change to any document
requires processing on all `sign_files`. We
recommended waiting until processing is finished
(and this value is true) before downloading the PDFs.

auto_expire_at.description: Uses `days_valid` to calculate the date and time, in GMT, the sign request will expire if unsigned.

allOf.description:
The destination folder to place final, signed document and signing
log.

When this value was not passed in when the signature request was 
created, then we will use a default folder which is either the parent
folder of the first source file in the payload if we have the permission
to upload to that folder or a folder called "My Sign Requests".

collaborator_level.description: The collaborator level of the user to the sign request. Values can include "owner", "editor", and "viewer".

short_id.description: Short identifier for the sign request.

created_at.description: Timestamp marking when the sign request was created.

finished_at.description: Timestamp indicating when all signing actions completed.

sender_email.description: The email address of the sender of the sign request.

sender_id.description: The user ID of the sender of the sign request.

SignRequest--Base.description: A standard representation of a signature request object.

is_document_preparation_needed.description: Indicates if the sender should receive a `prepare_url` in the response to complete document preparation using the UI.

redirect_url.description: When specified, the signature request will be redirected to this url when a document is signed.

declined_redirect_url.description: The uri that a signer will be redirected to after declining to sign a document.

are_text_signatures_enabled.description: Disables the usage of signatures generated by typing (text).

email_subject.description: Subject of sign request email. This is cleaned by sign request. If this field is not passed, a default subject will be used.

email_message.description: Message to include in sign request email. The field is cleaned through sanitization of specific characters. However, some html tags are allowed. Links included in the message are also converted to hyperlinks in the email. The message may contain the following html tags including `a`, `abbr`, `acronym`, `b`, `blockquote`, `code`, `em`, `i`, `ul`, `li`, `ol`, and `strong`. Be aware that when the text to html ratio is too high, the email may end up in spam filters. Custom styles on these tags are not allowed. If this field is not passed, a default message will be used.
email_message.example: Hello! Please sign the document below

are_reminders_enabled.description: Reminds signers to sign a document on day 3, 8, 13 and 18. Reminders are only sent to outstanding signers.

name.description: Name of the signature request.

prefill_tags.description: When a document contains sign-related tags in the content, you can prefill them using this `prefill_tags` by referencing the 'id' of the tag as the `external_id` field of the prefill tag.

days_valid.description: Set the number of days after which the created signature request will automatically expire if not completed. By default, we do not apply any expiration date on signature requests, and the signature request does not expire.

external_id.description: This can be used to reference an ID in an external system that the sign request is related to.

template_id.description: When a signature request is created from a template this field will indicate the id of that template.

external_system_name.description: Used as an optional system name to appear in the signature log next to the signers who have been assigned the `embed_url_external_id`.

SignRequest--Base.title: Box Sign request (Base)

SignRequestCreateRequest.description: Creates a Box Sign request object.

source_files.description: List of files to create a signing document from. This is currently limited to ten files. Only the ID and type fields are required for each file.

signature_color.description: Force a specific color for the signature (blue, black, or red).

signers.description:
Array of signers for the signature request. 35 is the
max number of signers permitted.

**Note**: It may happen that some signers belong to conflicting [segments](https://developer.box.com/reference/resources/shield-information-barrier-segment-member) (user groups).
This means that due to the security policies, users are assigned to segments to prevent exchanges or communication that could lead to ethical conflicts.
In such a case, an attempt to send the sign request will result in an error.

Read more about [segments and ethical walls](https://support.box.com/hc/en-us/articles/9920431507603-Understanding-Information-Barriers#h_01GFVJEHQA06N7XEZ4GCZ9GFAQ).

allOf.description:
The destination folder to place final, signed document and signing
log. Only `ID` and `type` fields are required. The root folder,
folder ID `0`, cannot be used and can also not be null.

When this value is not passed in when the signature request, then
we will use a default folder which is either the parent folder of
the first source file in the payload if we have the permission to
upload to that folder or a folder called "My Sign Requests".

SignRequestCreateRequest.title: Create a Box Sign request

SignRequestCreateSigner.description:
The schema for a Signer object used in
for creating a Box Sign request object.

email.description:
Email address of the signer.
The email address of the signer is required when making signature requests, except when using templates that are configured to include emails.

role.description:
Defines the role of the signer in the signature request. A `signer`
must sign the document and an `approver` must approve the document. A
`final_copy_reader` only receives the final signed document and signing
log.

is_in_person.description:
Used in combination with an embed URL for a sender. After the
sender signs, they are redirected to the next `in_person` signer.

embed_url_external_user_id.description:
User ID for the signer in an external application responsible
for authentication when accessing the embed URL.

redirect_url.description:
The URL that a signer will be redirected
to after signing a document. Defining this URL
overrides default or global redirect URL
settings for a specific signer.
If no declined redirect URL is specified,
this URL will be used for decline actions as well.

declined_redirect_url.description:
The URL that a signer will be redirect
to after declining to sign a document.
Defining this URL overrides default or global
declined redirect URL settings for a specific signer.

login_required.description:
If set to true, the signer will need to log in to a Box account
before signing the request. If the signer does not have
an existing account, they will have the option to create
a free Box account.

verification_phone_number.description:
If set, this phone number will be used to verify the signer
via two-factor authentication before they are able to sign the document.
Cannot be selected in combination with `login_required`.

password.description:
If set, the signer is required to enter the password before they are able
to sign a document. This field is write only.

signer_group_id.description:
If set, signers who have the same value will be assigned to the same input and to the same signer group.
A signer group is not a Box Group. It is an entity that belongs to a Sign Request and can only be
used/accessed within this Sign Request. A signer group is expected to have more than one signer.
If the provided value is only used for one signer, this value will be ignored and request will be handled
as it was intended for an individual signer. The value provided can be any string and only used to
determine which signers belongs to same group. A successful response will provide a generated UUID value
instead for signers in the same signer group.

suppress_notifications.description: If true, no emails about the sign request will be sent.

SignRequestCreateSigner.title: Signer fields used to create a Box Sign request object.

SignRequestPrefillTag.description:
Prefill tags are used to prefill placeholders with signer input data. Only
one value field can be included.

document_tag_id.description: This references the ID of a specific tag contained in a file of the signature request.

SignRequestPrefillTag.title: Sign request prefill tag

SignRequestSigner.description:
The schema for a Signer object used
on the body of a Box Sign request object.

has_viewed_document.description: Set to `true` if the signer views the document.

signer_decision.description: Final decision made by the signer.

type.description: Type of decision made by the signer.

finalized_at.description: Date and Time that the decision was made.

additional_info.description: Additional info about the decision, such as the decline reason from the signer.

embed_url.description: URL to direct a signer to for signing.

iframeable_embed_url.description:
This URL is specifically designed for
signing documents within an HTML `iframe` tag.
It will be returned in the response
only if the `embed_url_external_user_id`
parameter was passed in the
`create Box Sign request` call.

SignRequestSigner.title: Signer fields for Box Sign request response

SignRequestSignerAttachment.description: Metadata describing a file uploaded by a signer as an attachment.

id.description: Identifier of the attachment file.

name.description: Display name of the attachment file.

SignRequestSignerAttachment.title: Signer Attachment

SignRequestSignerInput.description: Input created by a Signer on a Sign Request.

page_index.description: Index of page that the input is on.

read_only.description: Indicates whether this input is read-only (cannot be modified by signers).

validation.description:
Specifies the formatting rules that signers must follow for text field inputs.
If set, this validation is mandatory.

anyOf.title: OpenAPI 3.0 null schema type
anyOf.description: The definition for a null schema type in OpenAPI `3.0`.

SignRequestSignerInput.title: Sign Request Signer Input

SignRequestSignerInputCustomValidation.description:
Specifies the custom validation rules for a text field input by the signer.
If set, this validation is mandatory.

validation_type.description:
Defines the validation format for the text input as custom.
A custom regular expression is used for validation.

custom_error_message.description: Error message shown if input fails custom regular expression validation.

SignRequestSignerInputCustomValidation.title: Sign Request Signer Input Custom Validation

SignRequestSignerInputDateAsiaValidation.description:
Specifies the date formatting rules used in Asia for a text field input by the signer. 
If set, this validation is mandatory. 
The date format follows `YYYY/MM/DD` pattern.

validation_type.description: Validates that the text input uses the Asian date format `YYYY/MM/DD`.

SignRequestSignerInputDateAsiaValidation.title: Sign Request Signer Input Date Asia Validation

SignRequestSignerInputDateEUValidation.description:
Specifies the date formatting rules used in Europe for a text field input by the signer. 
If set, this validation is mandatory. 
The date format follows `DD/MM/YYYY` pattern.

validation_type.description: Validates that the text input uses the European date format `DD/MM/YYYY`.

SignRequestSignerInputDateEUValidation.title: Sign Request Signer Input Date EU Validation

SignRequestSignerInputDateISOValidation.description:
Specifies the ISO date formatting rules for a text field input by the signer. 
If set, this validation is mandatory. 
The date format follows `YYYY-MM-DD` pattern.

validation_type.description: Validates that the text input uses the ISO date format `YYYY-MM-DD`.

SignRequestSignerInputDateISOValidation.title: Sign Request Signer Input Date ISO Validation

SignRequestSignerInputDateUSValidation.description:
Specifies the US date formatting rules for a text field input by the signer. 
If set, this validation is mandatory. 
The date format follows `MM/DD/YYYY` pattern.

validation_type.description: Validates that the text input uses the US date format `MM/DD/YYYY`.

SignRequestSignerInputDateUSValidation.title: Sign Request Signer Input Date US Validation

SignRequestSignerInputEmailValidation.description:
Specifies the formatting rules that signers must follow for text field inputs.
If set, this validation is mandatory.

validation_type.description: Validates that the text input is an email address.

SignRequestSignerInputEmailValidation.title: Sign Request Signer Input Email Validation

SignRequestSignerInputNumberWithCommaVal.description:
Specifies the number with comma formatting rules for a text field input by the signer.
If set, this validation is mandatory.

validation_type.description: Validates that the text input uses a number format with a comma as the decimal separator (for example, 1,23).

SignRequestSignerInputNumberWithCommaVal.title: Sign Request Signer Input Number With Comma Validation

SignRequestSignerInputNumberWithPeriodVa.description:
Specifies the number with period formatting rules for a text field input by the signer.
If set, this validation is mandatory.

validation_type.description: Validates that the text input uses a number format with a period as the decimal separator (for example, 1.23).

SignRequestSignerInputValidation.description:
Specifies the formatting rules that signers must follow for text field inputs.

The format can be selected from a predefined list of options (e.g., email, phone number, date) or
defined using a custom regular expression.

SignRequests.description:
A standard representation of a signature request, as returned from any Box Sign
API endpoints by default.

allOf.description:
The part of an API response that describes marker
based pagination.

limit.description:
The limit that was used for these entries. This will be the same as the
`limit` query parameter unless that value exceeded the maximum value
allowed. The maximum value varies by API.

next_marker.description: The marker for the start of the next page of results.

entries.description: A list of Box Sign requests.

SignRequests.title: Box Sign requests

id.description: Template identifier.

name.description: The name of the template.

email_subject.description:
Subject of signature request email. This is cleaned by sign
request. If this field is not passed, a default subject will be used.

email_message.description:
Message to include in signature request email. The field
is cleaned through sanitization of specific characters. However,
some html tags are allowed. Links included in the
message are also converted to hyperlinks in the email. The
message may contain the following html tags including `a`, `abbr`,
`acronym`, `b`, `blockquote`, `code`, `em`, `i`, `ul`, `li`, `ol`, and
`strong`. Be aware that when the text
to html ratio is too high, the email
may end up in spam filters. Custom styles on
these tags are not allowed.
If this field is not passed, a default message will be used.
email_message.example: Hello! Please sign the document below

days_valid.description:
Set the number of days after which the
created signature request will automatically
expire if not completed. By default, we do
not apply any expiration date on signature
requests, and the signature request does not expire.

allOf.description:
The destination folder to place final, signed document and signing
log. Only `ID` and `type` fields are required. The root folder,
folder ID `0`, cannot be used.

source_files.description:
List of files to create a signing document from.
Only the ID and type fields are required
for each file.

are_fields_locked.description:
Indicates if the template input
fields are editable or not.

are_options_locked.description:
Indicates if the template document options
are editable or not,
for example renaming the document.

are_recipients_locked.description: Indicates if the template signers are editable or not.

are_email_settings_locked.description: Indicates if the template email settings are editable or not.

are_files_locked.description:
Indicates if the template files are editable or not.
This includes deleting or renaming template files.

signers.description:
Array of signers for the template.

**Note**: It may happen that some signers specified in the template belong to conflicting [segments](https://developer.box.com/reference/resources/shield-information-barrier-segment-member) (user groups).
This means that due to the security policies, users are assigned to segments to prevent exchanges or communication that could lead to ethical conflicts.
In such a case, an attempt to send a sign request based on a template that lists signers in conflicting segments will result in an error.

Read more about [segments and ethical walls](https://support.box.com/hc/en-us/articles/9920431507603-Understanding-Information-Barriers#h_01GFVJEHQA06N7XEZ4GCZ9GFAQ).

additional_info.description:
Additional information on which fields are
required and which fields are not editable.

ready_sign_link.description:
Box's ready-sign link feature enables you to create a
link to a signature request that
you've created from a template. Use this link
when you want to post a signature request
on a public form  such as an email, social media post,
or web page  without knowing who the signers will be.
Note: The ready-sign link feature is
limited to Enterprise Plus customers and not
available to Box Verified Enterprises.

url.description: The URL that can be sent to signers.

name.description: Request name.

instructions.example: Hello! Please sign the document below

folder_id.description:
The destination folder to place final,
signed document and signing
log. Only `ID` and `type` fields are required.
The root folder,
folder ID `0`, cannot be used.

is_notification_disabled.description:
Whether to disable notifications when
a signer has signed.

is_active.description: Whether the ready sign link is enabled or not.

custom_branding.description:
Custom branding applied to notifications
and signature requests.

logo_uri.description: Custom branding logo URI in the form of a base64 image.

Task.description:
A task allows for file-centric workflows within Box. Users can
create tasks on files and assign them to other users for them to complete the
tasks.

id.description: The unique identifier for this task.

allOf.description: The file associated with the task.

action.description:
The type of task the task assignee will be prompted to
perform.

message.description: A message that will be included with the task.

allOf.description:
A collection of task assignment objects
associated with the task.

is_completed.description: Whether the task has been completed.

allOf.description: The user who created the task.

created_at.description: When the task object was created.

completion_rule.description:
Defines which assignees need to complete this task before the task
is considered completed.

* `all_assignees` requires all assignees to review or
approve the task in order for it to be considered completed.
* `any_assignee` accepts any one assignee to review or
approve the task in order for it to be considered completed.

Task.title: Task

TaskAssignment.description: A task assignment defines which task is assigned to which user to complete.

id.description: The unique identifier for this task assignment.

allOf.description: The file that the task has been assigned to.
The user that the task has been assigned to.

message.description:
A message that will is included with the task
assignment. This is visible to the assigned user in the web and mobile
UI.

completed_at.description:
The date at which this task assignment was
completed. This will be `null` if the task is not completed yet.

assigned_at.description: The date at which this task was assigned to the user.

reminded_at.description:
The date at which the assigned user was reminded of this task
assignment.

resolution_state.description:
The current state of the assignment. The available states depend on
the `action` value of the task object.

allOf.description: The user who assigned this task.

TaskAssignment.title: Task assignment

total_count.description: The total number of items in this collection.

entries.description: A list of task assignments.

total_count.description:
One greater than the offset of the last entry in the entire collection.
The total number of entries in the collection may be less than
`total_count`.

entries.description: A list of tasks.

TemplateSigner.description: The schema for a Signer for Templates.

role.description:
Defines the role of the signer in the signature request. A role of
`signer` needs to sign the document, a role `approver`
approves the document and
a `final_copy_reader` role only
receives the final signed document and signing log.

is_in_person.description:
Used in combination with an embed URL for a sender.
After the sender signs, they will be
redirected to the next `in_person` signer.

signer_group_id.description:
If provided, this value points signers that are assigned the same inputs and belongs to same signer group.
A signer group is not a Box Group. It is an entity that belongs to the template itself and can only be used
within Box Sign requests created from it.

label.description: A placeholder label for the signer set by the template creator to differentiate between signers.

public_id.description: An identifier for the signer. This can be used to identify a signer within the template.

is_password_required.description:
If true for signers with a defined email, the password provided when the template was created is used by default. 
If true for signers without a specified / defined email, the creator needs to provide a password when using the template.

is_phone_number_required.description:
If true for signers with a defined email, the phone number provided when the template was created is used by default. 
If true for signers without a specified / defined email, the template creator needs to provide a phone number when creating a request.

login_required.description: If true, the signer is required to login to access the document.

TemplateSigner.title: Signer fields for Templates

TemplateSignerInput.description: Input created by a Signer on a Template.

is_required.description: Whether or not the input is required.

page_index.description: Index of page that the input is on.

dropdown_choices.description:
When the input is of the type `dropdown` this
values will be filled with all the
dropdown options.

group_id.description:
When the input is of type `radio` they can be
grouped to gather with this identifier.

coordinates.description: Where the input is located on a page.

x.description: Relative x coordinate to the page the input is on, ranging from 0 to 1.

y.description: Relative y coordinate to the page the input is on, ranging from 0 to 1.

width.description: Relative width to the page the input is on, ranging from 0 to 1.

height.description: Relative height to the page the input is on, ranging from 0 to 1.

label.description: The label field is used especially for text, attachment, radio, and checkbox type inputs.

read_only.description: Indicates whether this input is read-only (cannot be modified by signers).

validation.description:
Specifies the formatting rules that signers must follow for text field inputs.
If set, this validation is mandatory.

TimelineSkillCard.description:
A Box Skill metadata card that places a list of images on a
timeline.

created_at.description: The optional date and time this card was created at.

code.description: An optional identifier for the title.

message.description: The actual title to show in the UI.

skill.description: The service that applied this metadata.

id.description:
A custom identifier that represent the service that
applied this metadata.

invocation.description:
The invocation of this service, used to track
which instance of a service applied the metadata.

id.description:
A custom identifier that represent the instance of
the service that applied this metadata. For example,
if your `image-recognition-service` runs on multiple
nodes, this field can be used to identify the ID of
the node that was used to apply the metadata.

duration.description: An total duration in seconds of the timeline.

entries.description: A list of entries on the timeline.

items.description: An single item that's placed on multiple items on the timeline.

text.description:
The text of the entry. This would be the display
name for an item being placed on the timeline, for example the name
of the person who was detected in a video.

appears.description:
Defines a list of timestamps for when this item should appear on the
timeline.

items.description: The timestamp for an entry.

start.description:
The time in seconds when an
entry should start appearing on a timeline.

end.description:
The time in seconds when an
entry should stop appearing on a timeline.

image_url.description:
The image to show on a for an entry that appears
on a timeline. This image URL is required for every entry.

The image will be shown in a
list of items (for example faces), and clicking
the image will show the user where that entry
appears during the duration of this entry.

TimelineSkillCard.title: Timeline Skill Card

TrackingCode.description:
Tracking codes allow an admin to generate reports from the admin console
and assign an attribute to a specific group of users.
This setting must be enabled for an enterprise before it can be used.

name.description:
The name of the tracking code, which must be preconfigured in
the Admin Console.

value.description: The value of the tracking code.

TrackingCode.title: Tracking code

skill.description: The service that applied this metadata.

A custom identifier that represent the service that

invocation.description:
The invocation of this service, used to track
which instance of a service applied the metadata.

A custom identifier that represent the instance of
the service that applied this metadata. For example,
if your `image-recognition-service` runs on multiple
nodes, this field can be used to identify the ID of
the node that was used to apply the metadata.

duration.description:
An optional total duration in seconds.

Used with a `skill_card_type` of `transcript` or
`timeline`.

entries.description:
An list of entries for the card. This represents the individual entries of
the transcription.

items.description: An entry in the `entries` attribute of a metadata card.

text.description:
The text of the entry. This would be the transcribed text assigned
to the entry on the timeline.
text.example: Hi, and welcome to this video...

appears.description:
Defines when a transcribed bit of text appears. This only includes a
start time and no end time.

items.description: The timestamp for an entry.

start.description:
The time in seconds when an
entry should start appearing on a timeline.

id.description:
The unique identifier that represent a file.

The ID for any file can be determined
by visiting a file in the web application
and copying the ID from the URL. For example,
for the URL `https://*.app.box.com/files/123`
the `file_id` is `123`.

etag.description:
The HTTP `etag` of this file. This can be used within some API
endpoints in the `If-Match` and `If-None-Match` headers to only
perform changes on the file if (no) changes have happened.

allOf.description:
A numeric identifier that represents the most recent user event
that has been applied to this item.

This can be used in combination with the `GET /events`-endpoint
to filter out user events that would have occurred before this
identifier was read.

An example would be where a Box Drive-like application
would fetch an item via the API, and then listen to incoming
user events for changes to the item. The application would
ignore any user events where the `sequence_id` in the event
is smaller than or equal to the `sequence_id` in the originally
fetched resource.

name.description: The name of the file.

sha1.description:
The SHA1 hash of the file. This can be used to compare the contents
of a file on Box with a local file.

allOf.description: The information about the current version of the file.

description.description: The optional description of this file.

size.description:
The file size in bytes. Be careful parsing this integer as it can
get very large and cause an integer overflow.

allOf.title: Path collection (Trash)
allOf.description: A list of parent folders for an item in the trash.

total_count.description: The number of folders in this list.

entries.description: Array of folders for this item's path collection.

items.description: The parent folder for this item.

id.description: The unique identifier that represent a folder.

sequence_id.description: This field is null for the Trash folder.

etag.description: This field is null for the Trash folder.

name.description: The name of the Trash folder.

allOf.description:
The tree of folders that this file is contained in,
starting at the root.

created_at.description: The date and time when the file was created on Box.

modified_at.description: The date and time when the file was last updated on Box.

trashed_at.description: The time at which this file was put in the trash.

purged_at.description:
The time at which this file is expected to be purged
from the trash.

content_created_at.description:
The date and time at which this file was originally
created, which might be before it was uploaded to Box.

content_modified_at.description:
The date and time at which this file was last updated,
which might be before it was uploaded to Box.

allOf.description: The user who created this file.
The user who last modified this file.
The user who owns this file.

shared_link.description:
The shared link for this file. This will
be `null` if a file has been trashed, since the link will no longer
be active.

allOf.description: The folder that this file is located within.

item_status.description:
Defines if this item has been deleted or not.

* `active` when the item has is not in the trash
* `trashed` when the item has been moved to the trash but not deleted
* `deleted` when the item has been permanently deleted.

This can be used in combination with the `GET /events`-endpoint

An example would be where a Box Drive-like application
would fetch an item via the API, and then listen to incoming
user events for changes to the item. The application would
ignore any user events where the `sequence_id` in the event
is smaller than or equal to the `sequence_id` in the originally
fetched resource.

Web links are objects that point to URLs. These objects
are also known as bookmarks within the Box web application.

Web link objects are treated similarly to file objects,
they will also support most actions that apply to regular files.

The description accompanying the web link. This is
visible within the Box web application.

allOf.title: Shared link
allOf.description:
Shared links provide direct, read-only access to files or folder on Box.

Shared links with open access level allow anyone with the URL
to access the item, while shared links with company or collaborators access
levels can only be accessed by appropriately authenticated Box users.

url.description:
The URL that can be used to access the item on Box.

This URL will display the item in Box's preview UI where the file
can be downloaded if allowed.

This URL will continue to work even when a custom `vanity_url`
has been set for this shared link.

download_url.description:
A URL that can be used to download the file. This URL can be used in
a browser to download the file. This URL includes the file
extension so that the file will be saved with the right file type.

This property will be `null` for folders.

vanity_url.description:
The "Custom URL" that can also be used to preview the item on Box.  Custom
URLs can only be created or modified in the Box Web application.

vanity_name.description: The custom name of a shared link, as used in the `vanity_url` field.

access.description:
The access level for this shared link.

* `open` - provides access to this item to anyone with this link
* `company` - only provides access to this item to people the same company
* `collaborators` - only provides access to this item to people who are
   collaborators on this item

If this field is omitted when creating the shared link, the access level
will be set to the default access level specified by the enterprise admin.

effective_access.description:
The effective access level for the shared link. This can be a more
restrictive access level than the value in the `access` field when the
enterprise settings restrict the allowed access levels.

effective_permission.description:
The effective permissions for this shared link.
These result in the more restrictive combination of
the share link permissions and the item permissions set
by the administrator, the owner, and any ancestor item
such as a folder.

unshared_at.description:
The date and time when this link will be unshared. This field can only be
set by users with paid accounts.

is_password_enabled.description: Defines if the shared link requires a password to access the item.

permissions.description:
Defines if this link allows a user to preview, edit, and download an item.
These permissions refer to the shared link only and
do not supersede permissions applied to the item itself.

can_download.description:
Defines if the shared link allows for the item to be downloaded. For
shared links on folders, this also applies to any items in the folder.

This value can be set to `true` when the effective access level is
set to `open` or `company`, not `collaborators`.

can_preview.description:
Defines if the shared link allows for the item to be previewed.

This value is always `true`. For shared links on folders this also
applies to any items in the folder.

can_edit.description:
Defines if the shared link allows for the item to be edited.

This value can only be `true` if `can_download` is also `true` and if
the item has a type of `file`.

download_count.description: The number of times this item has been downloaded.

preview_count.description: The number of times this item has been previewed.

allOf.description:
The shared link object for this item. Will be
`null` if no shared link has been created.

item_status.description:
Whether this item is deleted or not. Values include `active`,
`trashed` if the file has been moved to the trash, and `deleted` if
the file has been permanently deleted.

ZipDownload.description:
Represents a successful request to create a `zip` archive of a list of files
and folders.

download_url.description:
The URL that can be used to download the `zip` archive. A `Get` request to
this URL will start streaming the items requested. By default, this URL
is only valid for a few seconds, until the `expires_at` time, unless a
download is started after which it is valid for the duration of the
download.

It is important to note that the domain and path of this URL might change
between API calls, and therefore it's important to use this URL as-is.

status_url.description:
The URL that can be used to get the status of the `zip` archive being
downloaded. A `Get` request to this URL will return the number of files
in the archive as well as the number of items already downloaded or
skipped. By default, this URL is only valid for a few seconds, until the
`expires_at` time, unless a download is started after which the URL is
valid for 12 hours from the start of the download.

It is important to note that the domain and path of this URL might change
between API calls, and therefore it's important to use this URL as-is.

expires_at.description:
The time and date when this archive will expire. After this time the
`status_url` and `download_url` will return an error.

By default, these URLs are only valid for a few seconds, unless a download
is started after which the `download_url` is valid for the duration of the
download, and the `status_url` is valid for 12 hours from the start of the
download.

name_conflicts.description:
A list of conflicts that occurred when trying to create the archive. This
would occur when multiple items have been requested with the
same name.

To solve these conflicts, the API will automatically rename an item
and return a mapping between the original item's name and its new
name.

For every conflict, both files will be renamed and therefore this list
will always be a multiple of 2.

items.description:
An individual conflict that occurred when trying to create the archive.
This includes an array of 2 objects, each containing the original name
and the renamed filename of a file or folder for which the names
conflicted.

A file or folder for which a conflict was encountered, This object provides the type and identifier of the original item, as well as a mapping between its original name and it's new name as it will appear in the archive.

id.description: The identifier of the item.

download_name.description:
The new name of this item as it will appear in the
downloaded `zip` archive.

ZipDownload.title: Zip download

ZipDownloadRequest.description: A request to create a `zip` archive to download.

items.description:
A list of items to add to the `zip` archive. These can
be folders or files.
An item to add to the `zip` archive. This can be a file or a folder.

type.description: The type of the item to add to the archive.

id.description:
The identifier of the item to add to the archive. When this item is
a folder then this can not be the root folder with ID `0`.

download_file_name.description:
The optional name of the `zip` archive. This name will be appended by the
`.zip` file extension, for example `January Financials.zip`.

ZipDownloadRequest.title: Create a `zip` archive

ZipDownloadStatus.description: The status of a `zip` archive being downloaded.

total_file_count.description: The total number of files in the archive.

downloaded_file_count.description: The number of files that have already been downloaded.

skipped_file_count.description:
The number of files that have been skipped as they could not be
downloaded. In many cases this is due to permission issues that have
surfaced between the creation of the request for the archive and the
archive being downloaded.

skipped_folder_count.description:
The number of folders that have been skipped as they could not be
downloaded. In many cases this is due to permission issues that have
surfaced between the creation of the request for the archive and the
archive being downloaded.

state.description: The state of the archive being downloaded.

ZipDownloadStatus.title: Zip download status

scopes.root_readonly: Read all files and folders stored in Box
scopes.root_readwrite: Read and write all files and folders stored in Box
scopes.manage_webhook: Create webhooks programmatically through the API

tags.name: AI
tags.description:
A set of endpoints used to
interact with supported LLMs.

tags.name: AI Studio
tags.description:
A set of endpoints used to
interact with AI Studio.

tags.name: Authorization
tags.description:
A set of endpoints used to
manage user authorization process.

tags.name: Box Sign requests
tags.description:
Box Sign requests are used
to submit a file for
signature.

tags.name: Classifications
tags.description:
Classification labels are
used for content that is
sensitive or under security
restrictions.

tags.name: Classifications on files
tags.description:
Classification labels are
used for files that are
sensitive or under security
restrictions.

tags.name: Classifications on folders
tags.description:
Classification labels are
used for folders that are
sensitive or under security
restrictions.

tags.name: Collaborations
Collaborations (List)
tags.description:
A set of endpoints used to
retrieve file, folder,
pending, and group collaborations.

tags.name: Collections
tags.description:
Collections are a way to group files,
folders, and web links without putting them
all into a folder.

tags.name: Comments
tags.description:
Comments are messages generated users on files,
allowing users to collaborate on a file,
discussing any feedback they might
have on the content.

tags.name: Device pinners
tags.description:
Device pinners allow enterprises to
control what devices can use
native Box applications.

tags.name: Domain restrictions (User exemptions)
tags.description:
A set of endpoints that allow exempting users
from restrictions imposed by the list of
allowed collaboration domains for a specific enterprise.

tags.name: Domain restrictions for collaborations
tags.description:
A set of endpoints that manage domains for which users
can collaborate with files and folders in an enterprise.

tags.name: Downloads
tags.description:
Downloads allow saving files to the application's server,
or directly by the end user in a browser.

tags.name: Email aliases
tags.description:
Email aliases provide a list of emails additional
to the user's primary login email.

tags.name: Events
tags.description:
Events provide a way for an
application to subscribe to
any actions performed by
any user, users, or service in an enterprise.

tags.name: File requests
tags.description:
File Requests provide a fast and
secure way to request files and associated metadata
from anyone.
Users can create new file requests
based on an existing file request,
update file request settings, activate, deactivate, and delete
file requests programmatically.

tags.name: File version legal holds
tags.description:
A legal hold is a process that an enterprise
can use to preserve all forms of potentially relevant
information when
litigation is pending or reasonably anticipated.
A File Version Legal Hold represents all the policies that
are assigned to a specific file version.

tags.name: File version retentions
tags.description:
A retention policy blocks permanent
deletion of content for a specified amount of time.
A file version retention is a record for a retained file.

tags.name: File versions
tags.description:
A set of endpoints used to manage specific
versions of a file.

tags.name: Files
tags.description:
Files, together with Folders,
are at the core of the Box API.
Files can be uploaded and downloaded,
as well as hold important metadata
information about the content.

tags.name: Folder Locks
tags.description:
Folder locks define access restrictions
placed by folder owners to prevent
specific folders from being moved or deleted.

tags.name: Folders
tags.description:
Folders, together with Files,
are at the core of the Box API.
Folders can be uploaded and downloaded,
as well as hold important metadata
information about the content.

tags.name: Integration mappings
tags.description:
Integration Mappings allow the users
to manage where content from partner apps is stored in Box.

tags.name: Group memberships
tags.description:
Group memberships signify that
a user is a part of the group.

tags.name: Groups
tags.description: Groups created in an enterprise.

tags.name: Invites
tags.description:
Invites are used to invite the user to
an enterprise.

tags.name: Legal hold policies
tags.description:
A legal hold is a process that an enterprise
can use to preserve all forms of potentially
relevant information when litigation is pending or
reasonably anticipated.

tags.name: Legal hold policy assignments
tags.description:
A Legal Hold Policy Assignment
is a relation between a policy and custodian.
In this case, as custodian can be a user, folder,
file, or file version.

tags.name: Metadata cascade policies
tags.description:
A metadata cascade policy describes how metadata
instances applied to a folder should be applied
to any item within that folder.

tags.name: Metadata instances (Files)
tags.description:
A metadata instance describes
the relation between a template and a file,
including the values that are assigned for every field.

tags.name: Metadata instances (Folders)
tags.description:
A metadata instance describes the relation between a template and a folder,
including the values that are assigned for every field.

tags.name: Metadata taxonomies
tags.description:
A metadata taxonomy is a hierarchical classification system
that helps organize and manage metadata
within an enterprise.

tags.name: Metadata templates
tags.description:
A metadata template describes a reusable set
of key/value pairs that can be assigned to a file.

tags.name: Recent items
tags.description:
Recent items represent items such
as files or folders that
the user accessed recently.

tags.name: Retention policies
tags.description:
A retention policy blocks permanent deletion of content
for a specified amount of time. Admins can create
retention policies and then assign them to
specific folders or their entire enterprise.

tags.name: Retention policy assignments
tags.description:
A Retention Policy Assignment is a relation
between a policy and folder or enterprise.
Creating an assignment puts a retention on
all the file versions that belong to that folder or enterprise.

tags.name: Search
tags.description:
The Box API provides a way to find content in Box
using full-text search queries.

tags.name: Session termination
tags.description:
Session termination API is used to
validate the roles and permissions of the group,
and creates asynchronous jobs to terminate the group's sessions.

tags.name: Shared links (Files)
tags.description:
Files shared links are URLs that are generated for files stored in Box,
which provide direct, read-only access to the resource.

tags.name: Shared links (Folders)
tags.description:
Folders shared links are URLs that are generated for folders stored in Box,
which provide direct, read-only access to the resource.

tags.name: Shared links (Web Links)
Shared links (App Items)
tags.description:
URLs generated for app items stored in Box,
which provide direct, read-only access to the resource.

tags.name: Shield information barriers
tags.description:
Shield information barrier in Box defines an ethical wall.
An ethical wall is a mechanism that prevents exchanges or communication that
could lead to conflicts of interest and therefore result in
business activities ethically or legally questionable.

tags.name: Shield information barrier segments
tags.description:
Shield information barrier segment represents
a defined group of users. A user can be a member
of only one segment, which makes segments
different from groups.

tags.name: Shield information barrier segment members
tags.description:
Shield information barrier segment member
represents a user that is assigned to a
specific segment.

tags.name: Shield information barrier reports
tags.description:
Shield information barrier reports
contain information on what existing collaborations
will be removed permanently when the information barrier is enabled.

tags.name: Shield information barrier segment restrictions
tags.description:
Shield information barrier segment restriction is
an access restriction based on the content (file or folder) owner.

tags.name: Box Sign templates
tags.description:
Sign templates allow you to use a predefined Box Sign
template when creating a signature request.
The template includes placeholders that
are automatically populated with data when creating the request.

tags.name: Skills
tags.description:
Box Skills are designed to allow custom processing
of files uploaded to Box, with the
intent of enhancing the underlying metadata of the file.

tags.name: Standard and Zones Storage Policies
tags.description:
Storage policy assignment represents the
storage zone for items in a given enterprise.

tags.name: Standard and Zones Storage Policy Assignments
tags.description:
Storage policy assignment represents the
relation between storage zone and the
assigned item (for example a file stored
in a specific zone).

tags.name: Task assignments
tags.description:
A task assignment defines which
task is assigned to which user to complete.

tags.name: Tasks
tags.description:
Tasks allow users to request collaborators on a file
to review a file or complete a piece of work.
Tasks can be used by developers to create file-centric workflows.

tags.name: Terms of service
tags.description:
A set of endpoints used to
manage terms of service agreements.

tags.name: Terms of service user statuses
tags.description:
A set of endpoints used to
manage the status of terms of service
for a particular user.

tags.name: Transfer folders
tags.description:
API designed to move all of the items
(files, folders and workflows)
owned by a user into another user's account.

tags.name: Trashed files
tags.description:
Files that were deleted and
are in trash.

tags.name: Trashed folders
tags.description:
Folders that were deleted and
are in trash.

tags.name: Trashed items
tags.description:
Items that were deleted and
are in trash.

tags.name: Trashed web links
tags.description:
Web links that were deleted and
are in trash.

tags.name: Uploads
tags.description:
The direct file upload API supports files
up to 50MB in size and sends all
the binary data to the Box API in 1 API request.

tags.name: Uploads (Chunked)
tags.description:
The chunked upload endpoints support files from
20MB in size and allow an application
to upload the file in parts,
allowing for more control to catch any errors
and retry parts individually.

tags.name: User avatars
tags.description:
User avatars are JPG or PNG files
uploaded to Box to represent the
user image. They are then displayed
in the user account.

tags.name: Users
tags.description:
Box API supports a variety of users,
ranging from real employees
logging in with their Managed User account,
to applications using App Users to drive powerful
automation workflows.

tags.name: Watermarks (Files)
tags.description:
A watermark is a semi-transparent
overlay on an embedded file
preview that displays a viewer's email address
or user ID and the time of access over
the file.

tags.name: Watermarks (Folders)
tags.description:
A watermark is a semi-transparent overlay on an embedded folder
preview that displays a viewer's email address or user ID
and the time of access over
the folder content.

tags.name: Web links
tags.description:
Web links are objects that point to URLs.
These objects are also known as bookmarks
within the Box web application.

tags.name: Webhooks
tags.description:
Webhooks allow you to monitor Box content for events,
and receive notifications to a URL of your choice when they occur.
For example, a workflow may include waiting
for a file to be downloaded to delete a shared link.

tags.name: Workflows
tags.description:
Box Relay Workflows are objects that represent
a named collection of flows.

tags.name: Zip Downloads
tags.description:
Zip downloads represent a successful request
to create a ZIP archive with files and folders.
